main.title: List Of programs. A quick reference:
main.text: SBTCVM is distributed as an Application Suite for working with Balanced Ternary on binary computers. Here is a quick overview of what the various main programs are:
main.title: Command Line programs:
main.text: MK2-CS.py : This is the SBTCVM command shell. It provides a handy CLI for working with the more technical tools.
MK2-RUN.py : this is the command shell command "run". It starts SBTCVM with fine control. This is the same utility used by other utilities to launch the VM.
MK2-GFX.py : This is a graphics conversion tool.
MK2-GAT.py : SBTCVM Graphics Adapter Toolkit. This provides various helper functions related to SBTGA programming, such as generating framebuffer ranges from binary images (a PNG for example)
MK2-TOOLS.py : This is a tools launcher/debugging tool. It's primarily used for testing, backend debugging, and wraps various backend functions as descrete programs.
SBTCVM-asm2.py : This is SBTCVM's assembler. It's currently the best way to write SBTCVM programs, unless of course you like Machine code.
main.title: Special
main.text: SBTCVM_MK2.py : This is the VM itself, though to run the VM, please use MK2-RUN.py or "run" in the command shell.
main.title: GUI programs.
main.text: launcher.py : SBTCVM's Desktop multitasking environment and launcher.
calc.py : A graphical Balanced Ternary Calculator, complete with simultanious decimal and balanced ternary representation, input in both base numbers, and automatic conversion among other features.
helpview.py : SBTCVM's Integrated Help system (this program)
